word_mean: 毒素：通常是指某些高等植物、某些动物和致病菌产生的对其它生物有高度毒性的蛋白性物质，其与单纯化学毒物和植物生物碱的区别在于分子量大和具抗原性

sentence.Network_cn: 他们快把蓖麻毒素——一种致命的植物毒素——研发为武器了。

sentence.Network_en: Tests showed increased levels of toxin in shellfish.
sentence.Network_cn: 检验表明水生有壳动物的毒素水平提高了。

sentence.Network_en: To set a thief to catch a thief, that is what we call " to counteract one toxin with another ".
sentence.Network_cn: 叫小偷去抓小偷, 这就叫 “ 以毒攻毒 ”.

entry.def: A toxin is any poisonous substance produced by bacteria, animals, or plants.

example.ex: Experts have linked this condition to a build-up of toxins in the body…
example.tran: 专家已把这一病症与体内毒素的积累联系起来。

example.ex: Tests showed increased levels of toxin in shellfish.
example.tran: 检验表明水生有壳动物的毒素水平提高了。

means.word_mean: 1. a poisonous substance produced during the metabolism and growth of certain microorganisms and some higher plant and animal species

stems_affixes.word_buile: toxic[adj.有毒的;中毒的]+ation表名词→n.[医]中毒

in使+toxic[adj.有毒的;中毒的]+ate表动词→使中毒,陶醉

sentences.en: a treatment to cleanse the body of toxins
Most toxins are naturally excreted from the body.
sentences.cn: 大部分毒素被自然排出体外。
